toc_entry.title: Chilly Scenes Of Dinner
toc_entry.description: The old tin tray, it ain't what it used to be. Today’s Tv dinners have become “frozen cuisine. ”

toc_entry.title: The Gambler
toc_entry.description: Jack Young was the eighties’ oil boom in the flesh. Unfortunately, he also personifies the aftermath of the bust.
The quintessential wildcatter fills you in on free enterprise, A-rabs, and Texas after oil.

toc_entry.title: And Yet the Dream Endures
toc_entry.description: Don’t give up! There’s still money to be made finding oil. Up in Graham the Creswells are striking it rich with the help of Jesus and, er, creekology.

toc_entry.title: The Journeyman
toc_entry.description: Ed Jones rode the oil boom to a white-collar job. It was a short trip.

toc_entry.title: The Ten Best And the Ten Worst Legislators
toc_entry.description: We just rate them. You voted for them.

toc_entry.title: The Ranch Gate
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: These days it seems every five-acre ranchette flaunts a gate worthy of the Xit.

toc_entry.title: Wookiees On Parade
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Return of the Jedi is a star shower of new creatures and old favorites that leaves you wowed but underwhelmed. Breathless is suffocating. WarGames starts out with a bang and ends with a whimper. Flashdance has a certain twinkle.

toc_entry.title: Jazz In Camouflage
toc_entry.subtitle: Jazz
toc_entry.description: The music of tenor saxman John Handy is rooted in Texas and the blues, and he uses his distinctive sound to lure more listeners to jazz.

toc_entry.title: Those Raucous Babylonians
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: This spring both of Texas’ top symphonies staged the late William Walton’s Belshazzar’s Feast. Dallas held back, but Houston made merry with the splashy page 98 biblical spectacle.

toc_entry.title: Lady On the Edge
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: Photographer Carlotta Corpron moved to Denton in 1935, and the burst of avantgarde work she produced is, so far, unsurpassed in Texas.

toc_entry.title: A Knell For Eric
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: An Abilene man recalls the pluck and pain of his stricken son in This Is the Child. An El Paso professor creates a lovably uncool detective in Dancing Bear. An Austin meteorologist blows hot on Texas Weather.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: Go with the flow; made in the shade.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective statewide guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Saving the Fort Worth Stockyards; remembering the Hondo Hurricane; suing for peanuts; rotting your brain on Mtv.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Briscoe’s beef; new wave health care; a bright idea for Houston Lighting & Power; the case of the lagging law school.
